Merkle Trees in python

Jun 06, 2017

Merkle trees are data structures in which each leaf contains a piece of data and each node has a hash computed from its leafs.

But why store data in this way? if the data in a leaf change, it will change the hash of the whole branch and the root as well. so itâ€™s a good way to know if the tree has been tempered.
